intro: Anemone bulgarica, commonly known as the Bulgarian anemone, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are palmately lobed and hairy. The plant produces showy, single or double flowers with five petal-like sepals in shades of white, pink, or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Anemone bulgarica is often found in forest understories and along stream banks, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
